Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Essentials of Anatomy and Physiology
Description: Description: This course will focus on the basic structure and function of the human body from a systems perspective. Students will develop an understanding of normal human function required to recognize common illnesses and disease processes relevant to the OTA & PTA.Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: College Reading & Writing Skills
Description: Description: This course focuses on the reading, writing and critical thinking skills needed for academic and workplace success. Students will analyse, summarize, and discuss a variety of readings and apply the steps of planning, writing, and revising in response to written prompts. This course prepares students for post-secondary writing tasks, research, and documentation. Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Conestoga 101
Description: Description: This self-directed course focuses on introducing new students to the supports, services, and opportunities available at Conestoga College. By the end of this course, students will understand the academic expectations of the Conestoga learning environment, as well as the supports available to ensure their academic success. Students will also be able to identify on-campus services that support their health and wellness, and explore ways to get actively involved in the Conestoga community through co-curricular learning opportunities.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Safety in the Workplace
Description: Description: This course focuses on developing awareness and skills for the student to safely manage and conduct him or herself within a variety of employment settings. Through the units of the course, participants will have the opportunity to enhance their understanding and knowledge of general Health and Safety guidelines, including WHMIS, Fire Safety and Workplace Violence. The unit on Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act will instruct the student on the requirements for Accessible Customer Service and Integrated Accessibility Standard Regulations. General information on Safe Driving, Privacy of Information and Hand Washing will be addressed as well. The course also provides participants with critical information regarding their insurance coverage (WSIB or other) while employed. As well as guidelines to follow in the event of an injury. Participants will receive a printable Record of Completion upon successful conclusion of this course, in order to demonstrate awareness of safe working practices to their employers.Hours: 14Credits: 1Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Anatomy of Movement
Description: Description: The student will be introduced to the structure and function of the key body systems involved in human movement.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Orientation to Rehabilitation
Description: Description: This course will provide students with the foundations for a career in a health care or rehabilitation setting. Using a combination of lecture and small group case based learning approaches, students will explore philosophical, professional, and ethical concepts in rehabilitation that support the role of assistants in occupational therapy and physiotherapy. Students will also be introduced to basic medical terminology and clinical documentation skills and begin developing a fieldwork portfolio that will form the basis of a career portfolio upon graduation. Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites: OPA1000, OPA1020

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Fundamentals of Patient Care
Description: Description: This course integrates theory and lab activities to give the student the foundational skills to ensure safe client contact.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 2
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Field Placement I (Occupational & Physiotherapy Assistant)
Description: Description: Students will use this first clinical fieldwork experience to develop role clarity and to explore the responsibilities of the OTA/PTA in a health care setting and to apply theory and practical skills learned to date. Students will interact with members of the health care team as they begin to apply the knowledge they have gained to date.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Interpersonal Skills and Therapeutic Relationships
Description: Description: This course will provide students with the essential principles and skills of interpersonal communication required to establish effective relationships with clients, families and other health care professionals.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Practice Skills - Foundations of Occupational Therapy
Description: Description: This integrated lecture and lab course provides an introduction to relevant theory, principles and basic clinical skills for occupational therapy practice. Students will develop an understanding of the relationship between occupational performance components of an individual, the influence of the environment and the impact on occupational performance areas of self-care, productivity and leisure. Theory lectures and practical skill labs will provide students with an opportunity to apply core concepts such as activity analysis, grading, adapting, and the teaching and learning process to support participation in basic activities of daily living and environmental accessibility.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Practice Skills - Modalities
Description: Description: Students will rely on their knowledge of anatomy, physiology and pathology while studying the major uses of, rationale for and precautions and contradictions for the

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Practice Skills - Exercise
Description: Description: This course introduces the student to therapeutic exercise, the most common intervention used in Physical Therapy care plans. Using an integrated approach to theory and practice, students will gain an understanding of the rationale for various exercise techniques.

Name: Health Conditions I

Name: Level 3
Description: NA

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Field Placement II (Occupational & Physiotherapy Assistant )
Description: Description: In this placement students will gain greater autonomy as they continue to apply the knowledge they have acquired in previous and concurrent coursework.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Advanced Practice Skills for OTA
Description: Description: This integrated lecture and lab course expands on the foundations of occupational therapy and focuses on practicing and applying advanced therapeutic interventions within the scope of the OTA to address activity limitations and participation restrictions.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Advanced Practice Skills for PTA
Description: Description: This integrated lecture and lab course expands on the foundations of occupational therapy and focuses on practicing and applying advanced therapeutic interventions within the role of the OTA to address activity limitations and participation restrictions. Instruction will be provided on the safe application, fabrication or modification of assistive devices/technology, splinting, seating/mobility; and the use of functional tasks to address complex motor, sensory, perceptual, cognitive and socio-emotional needs across the lifespan. Hours: 56Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: OPA1220 or OPA1225, OPA1230 or OPA1235, OPA1240 or OPA1245CoRequisites: FPLT2230

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Communication Disorders
Description: Description: This course will introduce students to communication disorders which occur throughout the lifespan and practical strategies for effective communication with individuals who have communication disorders.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Practice Skills - Mental Health Concepts
Description: Description: This course introduces the student to commonly encountered mental health conditions and develops the skills and knowledge necessary to respond therapeutically within the parameters of the OTA/PTA role.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Health Conditions II
Description: Description: This course expands on the knowledge from Health Conditions I by introducing more medically complex conditions that may also include cognitive and mental health issues. Pathology, etiology, prevalence, clinical signs and symptoms of more complex health conditions will be discussed to reinforce understanding of how impairment in body function and structures can limit activity and restrict participation. Students will concurrently develop a general understanding of the medical, surgical, pharmacological and rehabilitation management for these conditions and recognize how this knowledge can be used to support and optimize client outcomes. Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: OPA1220 or OPA1225, OPA1230 or OPA1235, OPA1240 or OPA1245, OPA1250 or OPA1255, FPLT1320 or OPA1210, OPA1200CoRequisites: FPLT2230, OPA2115, OPA2125, OPA2130, OPA2140

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Field Placement III (Occupational & Physiotherapy Assistant)
Description: Description: By the end of this clinical practice experience, students will have achieved entry level status as OTA/PTAs. Throughout this experience they will continue to develop the professional behaviours and skills required for the workplace.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Professional and Interprofessional Issues
Description: Description: This course will address issues dealing with the transition from student to practitioner. Students will be challenged to utilize theory and clinical knowledge from preceding semesters as they explore relevant issues related to the current role of the OTA&PTA in an interdisciplinary health care environment.Hours: 42Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: FPLT2230 or OPA2100, OPA2130, OPA2155, OPA2140, OPA2125, OPA2115CoRequisites: FPLT2240
